snippet: Turkey’s Parliament met through the night, Friday into Saturday, and passed a controversial new bill that gives the government greater control over the judiciary.
abstract: Turkish Parliament passes controversial bill giving government greater control over courts; critics say bill is attempt to curtail corruption investigation of Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan; two lawmakers are injured when debate turns into brawl.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and TIM ARANGO

lead_paragraph: Turkey’s Parliament met through the night, Friday into Saturday, and passed a controversial new bill that gives the government greater control over the judiciary.

headline.main: A Debate Becomes a Brawl as Turkey’s Parliament Votes to Rein In Courts
headline.print_headline: A Debate Becomes a Brawl as Turkey’s Parliament Votes to Rein in Courts
